note.p: Death: His residence, 11 Savile Row, London (03 June 1896)
Education: King's College, London. MB (1841), MD (1844)

Career: Assistant Physician, King's College Hospital, London (1847); Physician, King's College Hospital (1856); Professor of Medicine, King's College, London (for 13 years); Physician Extraordinary to Queen Victoria (1889); died of cerebral haemorrage
Memberships: MRCP (1846); FRCP (1850); Royal Medico-Chirurgical Society (President 1884)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1896-1897 vol 60 pp xvi-xx signed by W D H
